New York Times (July 26, 1937), p. 21July 26 21 New York Times 1937

A. D. Charomskii, an engineer in charge of constructing experimental aviation motors. In the early thirties, a dispute arose over control of an experimental factory which the automobile industry was attempting to take away from aviation. "The question could only be decided by I. V. Stalin, and Stalin was in Sochi." So Charomskii was required to fly to the Black Sea resort to receive Stalin's personal decision giving control of the factory to aviation (Byli industrial 'nye: Ocherki i vos- pominaniia [Moscow, 1973], p. 116)
Charomskii
116 Byli industrial 'nye: Ocherki i vospominaniia 1973
